From which organism was methyl pyropheophorbide a (1) prepared?
What is the molecular weight of the dimer formed in CHCl3 according to osmometric MW determination?
What does the appearance of a new low-energy Q absorption at 14440 cm-1 in the spectra indicate?
What is the effect of adding 2 equiv of 4-(N,N-dimethylamino)pyridine to the monomeric zinc(II) pyropheophorbide?
Why does the O-methyloxime zinc(II) pyropheophorbide (4) not form a dimer in CDCl3 solution?
data.answer: Due to increased steric hindrance to zinc coordination at nitrogen.

data.question: What does rapid monomer−dimer exchange on the NMR time scale indicate about the ligating ability of oxime nitrogen toward zinc(II)?
data.answer: It reflects the weak ligating ability of oxime nitrogen toward zinc(II).

data.question: What structural form does the zinc(II) pyropheophorbide derivative 2 take in the solid state?
What is the geometry of each zinc atom in the solid-state structure of 2·CHCl3?
What does the presence of a second low-energy absorption at 13240 cm-1 in the most concentrated solution suggest?
data.answer: The result of a higher aggregate.
